instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
Hello;

I ve got a macbook pro model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> when powering it you hear the chime and the fun spins I got no picture. 
Can you please give me some hints where to begin troubleshooting?

Greeting

Rachid

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message: No picture or no backlight? Hold a flashlight on the back of the Apple logo and see if you can see anything.

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message: What voltage do you have on pin 1, then 28/29/30 of the LCD connector?

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
It is no backlight.
When pushing the power button I hear the chime. Fan spins and with a close look to the display, I see a little bit light. But I cannot decifer what I see. The lcd remains dark. Even eith a flash light I cannot see the os loading or anything else.

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
I see that i can further follow why the <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is not generated. But I faced the next problem: for example need to see if <DIODE>D7710</DIODE> is ok. Then the L7710 then the <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> etc... but those components are at the other side of the board. Need to take it out of the case and test them. The problem is that those are "S0" signals that need to be measured on running state "S0". I m right?

Also need to understand how the U700 works. Important input/output signals ?

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
Yes you do have to get used to testing with the board outside the machine, which is a pain in the ass of jumbling wires around and twisting things into all sorts of weird positions. The backlight circuit will not come on without the screen plugged in so anytime we are measuring voltage we have to turn it on with a known good screen plugged in.

1) What do you get at pins 4 and 3 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>?
2) What is the resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> with a screen plugged in, and a screen not plugged in?

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
Resistance to ground op pin 1 <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 160kohm screen plugged. 
Without plugged 163kohm. Without power.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> PIN3 1V and PIN4 1V1.
Even on F7700 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage is 1V1.
Means <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is missing.

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
Hello;

I ve done some further measurements. Please check next:

[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]1- At F7700 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0V[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]2- L7130 pin1/2 to GND gives short. In diode mode it gives 0.05[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]3- lifted L7130. Pin2 gives short only. Means short in the direction of pin2.[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]4- lifted F7140 pin2 only gives short.[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]5- Pin4 only of <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> gives short to GND[/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]6- Checked the IC <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> seems to be dammaged. Look foto:[/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]Please check the image of the ic.[/FONT][/COLOR]
[ATTACH=CONFIG]temp_621_1475154035223_47[/ATTACH]
[COLOR=#222222][FONT=arial]7- lifted the IC <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> but short remains on pin4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>.
But the short still there at Pin3.

Any suggestions[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
Why are you messing with L7130? The system works this has nothing to do with the backlight if there was a short on L7130 there would be no PPBUS and system would be dead.
Is F7700 blown, it must be when there is a short on pin 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>.

At this point is the machine still working?

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
I ve lifted the coil L7130 because I ve found a short along that line. On both pins of the coil. So to have an indication where the short can be caused is to separate that line where the short is. To get that done I had to lift the coil L7130. Like that I have separatede the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> from the <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.  When testing I ve seen that there is no short is detected in pin 1 of the coil L7130, but the short remains on pin2. This means that the short can be caused from the other side of the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
AND <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> must be 8V6. But at pin1/2 of F7700 1V1. 
F7700 is not blown and the voltage on pin4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> is 1V1.
I ve lifted the ic <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> because of the blown like image it shows at the top of it like you see on the picture. 
In my opinion there is only two ways left to be checked that can cause the short namely, <SIGNAL>ISNS_LCDBKLT_P</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>ISNS_LCDBKLT_N</SIGNAL>.

Your latst question concerning if it is still working, I need to solder the IC <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> back, that I think is bad, and will let you know.

threads.title: Chime but no picture
threads.message:
Dukefawaks, you are right.
The situation is as next. We got 2 macbook air for reparation. I ve mentionned the problem of the one I ve checked. The next day my colleague moves that one from the place I ve lefted him. The next day I ve done some measurement on the wrong one that was put on same table as the day before. Thinking that it was the same one. But it wasn't.

The first one I ve checked had indeed chime but no beeld. But all the measurements I ve done were on the one that was tottaly dead.

Sorry guys. I ve just noticed this today.

I think that we close this thread as not solved. And I will begin a new one.

Sorry again.
